Dialogue: brings the SONG to a blistering end. The stage is plunged into darkness.  He strips off his guitar, cuts from the stage, ignoring the grave looks from his Band Members.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What the fuck's wrong with you, Prince?!

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: I don't have time for your bullshit, Billy.  What do you want?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: My stage is no place for your personal shit!

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Life my ass, motherfucker! This is a business, and you're not too far gone to see that.  I've told you this before. You're not pulling them in like you used to.  The only person who gives a fuck about your music is yourself.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Yeah -- you got it.  Tell me I'm wrong.  You're not blind.  Look around you.  No one's digging you.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Look at your band.  Are they in here right now?  They're out there 'cause they can't stand being in the same room with you.  What a fucking waste...like father, like son--

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Take your head out of your ass, Prince, check it out -- unless you like the view up there.  Your music doesn't make sense to anyone but yourself.

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: That was fucked up what you did man.  Morris doesn't like it. And being a part of this - - I don't like it either.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: Hee, hee...huh, it's obvious you don't have what it takes to be on top.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: But to show you that I'm sympathetic to your problems - - here's a pass to our show tomorrow night.  Enjoy it.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: Don't forget to bring a girlfriend.  Whawhak!

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: cuts from the dressing room, closes the door behind him.  He joins Jerome at the curtain, and they move down the back stairway to the CLUB--

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: I think I'm going to be sick. Why does this have to be happening to me?  Has it crossed your mind that we're about to make the biggest mistake we've ever made?

Speaker: jerome
Dialogue: I don't think it's all that bad.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: That's why I do all the thinking.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: and Jerome are beside themselves with happiness.  The pull off their shades immediately, sit back and glow in the audience's response.

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: stands in the back, his eyes glued to Vanity.  Her strength and sureness in front of the Crowd is breathtaking.  The audience loves her and he suddenly feels very alone -- as if another wall has gone up between them.  He looks away a moment and spots...

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: watches the Girls bowing to thunderous APPLAUSE.  Suddenly Vanity looks at him and touches the earring she's wearing -- it's his Mother's.  His knees weaken instantly, and he locks eyes with her. The heat between them is unmistakable. She smiles vividly, gives him an endearing wave and steps back as the curtain closes.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: and the Girls rush into the dressing room and jump up and down with excitement.  They are beside themselves with happiness, kissing and hugging one another avidly.  Suddenly Vanity pulls away, indicates she will be back and cuts out the room.

Speaker: hallway
Dialogue: as she runs down the hallway to the backstage area, peers from behind the curtain, scanning the club earnestly.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Morris is squeezing you, kiddo.  You better kick ass tomorrow night or else.

Speaker: backstage
Dialogue: as Vanity watches Prince leave.  A profound sadness sweeps her face. Suddenly Susan is by her Side, hugging and kissing her happily.  Brenda runs up, pouring champagne.  Morris, Jerome and The Time are at the end of the hallway and beckon her excitedly into the room.  Vanity forces a smile, goes down the hallway, casting another look at the exit door.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: Did you hear these people applauding?  They loved us -- they wanted to rip us apart, and this is just our first night.  I can see it now, we're all going to be big stars.  I can feel it.

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: I gave him the night off.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: So here we are again.  So this is it, huh?  What do you want this time?

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: What's your problem now? What's your main problem?

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: No problem.  I just wanted to talk, alright? I just want us to be okay, to really get along.  No big deal.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: No, definitely not.  Who are you?  You can't tell me what to do.

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: Please don't drink that.  Give it to me.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: If you put your hands on me like that ever again, I'll be the last person you touch.

Speaker: the driver
Dialogue: spots her in his HEADLIGHTS, SLAMS on his brakes!  He SKIDS wildly across the road, comes to a SCREECHING, BURNING stop inches from her thigh!

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: shoots a look at Prince, her lips trembling, her love for him, written plainly on her face.  But his eyes flash defiantly.  She bites her lip sadly, then snaps a hot look at the Driver--

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: sits motionless a long time.  Moonlight floods the basement with a foreboding light.  A dog BARKS somewhere in the distance.  He looks up suddenly, his face agitated, his eyes red from tears.

Speaker: another angle
Dialogue: Cool, gray dawn.  He's in a dead sleep on the floor, his arms outstretched, his legs twisted beneath him.  His Father's outline seemingly rests by his side...

Speaker: mc
Dialogue: Let's bring them back!  Ladies and gentlemen, The Time!

Speaker: morris
Dialogue: You love us right?!  You want us right?!  I can't hear you!

Speaker: band members
Dialogue: It's all over now.  He better watch out.  He doesn't even need to go on.  He might as well go home.

Speaker: mc
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, please welcome Prince!

Speaker: billy sparks
Dialogue: leans against the bar, a smug look on his face.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: walks slowly up the stairs, gazes at Prince.

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: does not move.  The APPLAUSE trickles away.  He continues to stare in the audience making no attempt to direct his Band, or start a tune.  A nervous TWITTER ripples though the crowd.  Those who know about the tragedy feel a profound embarrassment for him -- but no one turns away.  Then his voice comes clear and mellifluous--

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: I would like to do a song that two of my friends wrote.

Speaker: vanity
Dialogue: is crying.  Every moment she has shared with him is expressed in this song, and the effect on her is unnerving.  Her heart leaps to him in a way she never thought possible.  But she lets it go willingly, as the words draw her in, seducing her somehow, making her free...as if the music, his words, all that he has experienced and  understood, is purging what is confused and ugly within herself, leaving her with an understanding and joy that burns in her womb like soft fire.  A smile springs to her lips as tears continue to flow, and she finds herself moving closer...

Speaker: prince
Dialogue: is still running though, his face streaming with tears, past the surprised look of Jill, past the FANS, past everyone -- stripping of his clothes fiercely, flinging off his jacket, his shirt, his scarf--

Speaker: stage
Dialogue: THUNDER!  Prince walks center- stage...and bows.  The AUDIENCE goes BERSERK!  He acknowledges Wendy and Lisa, and then the entire Band.  The CROWD is jumping out of their skin!  He straps on his guitar, gives a deft signal and--
